SEARCH
Package microsim.simulation.component.memory

Class MemorySpace

java.lang.Object
microsim.simulation.component.SimulationComponent
microsim.simulation.component.memory.MemorySpace
public class MemorySpace extends SimulationComponent
Implements a memory space as a (to outside users) contiguous array of byte locations. Memory is divided in three regions:
  1. EPROM: contains program code and data at startup.
  2. RAM: for general access.
  3. VRAM: gets rendered to video on VideoRenderer.render() calls.
Regions are defined by begin/end address pairs. End addresses are inclusive (0x000 to 0x0ff means 0x0ff is in the region and 0x100 isn't).

    • checkAlignment

      private boolean checkAlignment(int addr, int byteSelect)
      Checks if an address is aligned to the word size specified by byteSelect.
      Parameters:
      addr - address to check
      byteSelect - word size
      Returns:
      boolean that signals whether alignment is respected

    • step

      public final void step()
      Steps by handling read/write operations seen on bus. Bus protocol is the following:
      • If Bus.readEnable is high, start a read operation:
        1. Read address from Bus.addressLine.
        2. Read data at address.
        3. Drive Bus.dataLine for 1 simulation step.
      • If Bus.writeEnable is high, start a write operation:
        1. Read address from Bus.addressLine and data from Bus.dataLine.
        2. Write data at address.
      If both Bus.readEnable and Bus.writeEnable are high, raises an exception. If requested address is out of bounds, expect it to be a I/O operation and ignore.
      Specified by:
      step in class SimulationComponent

    • readMemory

      private byte readMemory(int addr)
      Reads from memory space at a given address within simulation bounds (nothing changes but the method is kept for symmetry). Implementation is done encapsulating readMemory(int, boolean) with debugMode always false.
      Parameters:
      addr - address to read from
      Returns:
      data read

    • readMemory

      public byte readMemory(int addr, boolean debugMode)
      Reads from memory space at a given address. The debugMode flag specifies if forbidden behavior should be enforced: the DebugShell class uses it to allow debug operations.
      Parameters:
      addr - address to read from
      debugMode - enforce simulation correctness
      Returns:
      data read

    • writeMemory

      private void writeMemory(int addr, byte data)
      Writes to memory space at a given address within simulation bounds. This means EPROM reads are forbidden. Implementation is done encapsulating readMemory(int, boolean) with debugMode always false.
      Parameters:
      addr - address to write to
      data - data to write

    • writeMemory

      public void writeMemory(int addr, byte data, boolean debugMode)
      Writes to memory space at a given address. The debugMode flag specifies if forbidden behavior should be enforced: usage is same as readMemory(int, boolean).
      Parameters:
      addr - address to write to
      data - data to write
      debugMode - enforce simulation correctness

    • getVRAM

      public byte[] getVRAM()
      Returns VRAM byte array. Used by VideoRenderer for direct VRAM accesses when rendering to frame buffer.
      Returns:
      VRAM byte array
